WRITING.TEXT: Hu Kitchen for super clean gluten-free.

I had the same thing (pvc) happen out of the blue about 12 years ago. It was debilitating because it interfered with my sleep for weeks on end. There was nothing that helped. Saw lots of doctors and that #8217;s when I found out I was hypo. Can #8217;t say I know what helped it go away other than time and levo. I get palpitations (which are different) now but that seems related to drinking alcohol before bed, etc. When my levo dose was too high a few years ago I did end up in the ER because I felt like I was having a heart attack, but that was a different sensation from pvc or palps. Hope the right levo dose helps it go away.
34, both parents, grandmother, uncle (that I know of)

I #8217;ve had stomach problems since starting AIP. My digestion was GREAT before. Got worse when I went GF and is still not great on AIP (diarrhea some days) but TBH I #8217;m not 100.00% compliant. I suspected it was the increase in nuts I was eating while I was GF and on AIP I #8217;ve been eating more dried fruits (figs and dates like you) and a ton more coconut - milk w/out guar gum and chips. So I #8217;m experimenting with keto AIP to avoid overdosing on sugar and also cutting down on the coconut.

WRITING.TITLE: Reacting to nuts
WRITING.TEXT: This may be a really stupid question but... do I have to avoid nuts completely if I have an #8220;itchy mouth #8221; reaction to them upon reintroduction? I love nuts and used to eat a lot of them but NOT peanuts because I know now I am sensitive to them (itchy mouth and more). After cutting nuts out for over a month I #8217;ve tried them twice and twice have gotten a mild itchy mouth/tongue reaction. I would like to eat just two Brazil nuts a day for the selenium (I am hypothyroid) but since I am getting this immediate reaction I #8217;m assuming I should avoid nuts completely in case they are doing more systemic damage, right?

Thanks all. Very helpful. I never had this reaction before AIP and ate tubs and tubs of peanut butter my whole life before realizing it wasn #8217;t good for my body. After cutting it out and reintroducing peanuts the same thing happened (years prior to AIP).
Garlic and onions you say? Instant migraine ;)
I #8217;ve never had significant pollen allergies but who knows? As I get older my body gets wackier...
Interesting. They are not organic so I may need to test this out.
Average resting hr for me (treated hypo so TSH is in range) is 50-55 with a low of 40 according to my Apple Watch.

Do you think you might be sensitive to a food you #8217;re still eating? I have an allium intolerance that causes major fatigue/brain fog/migraines so I can #8217;t eat onions or garlic for instance, even though they aren #8217;t restricted on AIP.
Not common. Just my weird particular affliction. My point is there could be something you still need to eliminate and test.
This just happened to me. Can you tolerate coconut milk and other fruits? If so start with a smoothie? Also try sweet potato or avocado. And eat small amounts at first. Hope you feel better!

I think this happened to me a few years ago. I #8217;m undiagnosed (waiting on second set of MRI results) but ended up having an episode of excruciating chest pain (went to urgent care then two different ERs in one night, literally crawling on all fours onto elevator). Had follow up with cardio and lots of tests but heart was fine (duh). The episode lasted probably 12 hours and was the most pain I #8217;ve ever felt besides childbirth. Felt like all my internal organs were being squeezed tight, had weird trapped air burping, and just unbelievable pain. Afterward I thought it might have been a reaction to my levo dose being a little too high but it wasn #8217;t that high and that doesn #8217;t really make sense to me now...

WRITING.TITLE: Small thyroid?
WRITING.TEXT: I just got results of a cervical MRI that noted a #8220;small thyroid gland #8221;. I #8217;ve been treated for hypo for years but continue to feel like crap. DAE have a small thyroid? Could it be congenital versus autoimmune and could it contribute to symptoms? I have had TPO tested once with normal results. TSH is within range with current levo dose.

Keto AIP seems hard to stick to. I am in a similar boat trying to decide between the two diets. I don #8217;t think AIP helped me feel much better so I #8217;m going to compare it to keto. I don #8217;t like the idea of adding back a lot of dairy so I will probably try to minimize that. We #8217;ll see!
Sounds like postdrome which is a fatigue/fog period after a migraine.

WRITING.TITLE: Brain fog only?
WRITING.TEXT: Has anyone gone low-FODMAPS to address non-gastro symptoms only? My situation: I have minimal to no digestive problems especially when I stick to paleo or AIP but continue to have debilitating fatigue and brain fog. I #8217;m wondering if the increase in avocados, cauliflower, beets, etc. I #8217;m eating recently could be affecting me and I #8217;m considering switching elimination diets! I already 100% avoid alliums because they cause migraines/fatigue/fog. Edited to add: I was checked for celiac (negative) but am nonetheless gluten free. I also take a B complex with B12 and have my levels checked. And I #8217;m treated for hypothyroid and levels are within range. Have also ruled out major autoimmune disorders including MS through extensive testing.
Thank you! Life would feel amazing without this.

Thank you for sharing. I am definitely going to keep searching for AI conditions - my whole immediate family suffers from many so I know it could be likely that I have at least one. What #8217;s weird is I am hypo but without Hashimoto #8217;s (no antibodies at least)

I have no experience with chiropractic but I #8217;m curious about the effect of cervical spine alignment on thyroid function. If your thyroid is #8220;restricted #8221; by a bulging disc or otherwise #8220;crowded #8221; by, say, reverse lordosis (neck that curves backward) could it become under active? I #8217;m sure this sounds stupid/crazy when I say it out loud but I have been searching for years for the root cause of my hypothyroidism (does not appear to be autoimmune) and recently learned from an MRI that I have reverse cervical lordosis, mild disc bulge at C5/C6 and a #8220;small thyroid #8221;. Probably just coincidence but I am prone to crazy health rabbit holes in an attempt to find a way to feel better (TSH treated and in range but still symptomatic).
Huh. That is weird! But glad you figured it out and that you can eat gluten again!

Came to reddit to search for AIWS because I just felt a twinge of it this morning while meditating. I experienced it as a child and have a history of migraines with visual auras as an adult. Super curious about the connection with meditation! Do those who experience it during their practice also have a history of migraines or can it happen to people without migraines/auras?!

Auras are visual disturbances that often come with migraines. Usually before, as a warning of an oncoming migraine. They can also happen without a headache. They vary widely but common ones are a band of shimmering, jagged colors/lights interrupting your vision, or blind or blurry spots or other visual weirdness. I believe they can also be sensory vs visual... https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aura_(symptom)

Interesting. I #8217;ve noticed bad reactions to certain probiotics which included brain fog in the past and recently cut out the one I was taking daily. That and/or going low carb seems to have gotten rid of the worst of the brain fog for me for now....

Yup. I don #8217;t think it necessarily has to be autoimmune related. I developed an intolerance to all alliums as an adult and have to avoid them or I get immediate migraine, brain fog, fatigue, yucky feeling. It #8217;s possible it is FODMAPS but I haven #8217;t done the full elimination diet to know for sure.

WRITING.TITLE: Carb Manager - net cals or total cals?
WRITING.TEXT: For those using Carb Manager, have you had scale success setting it to add calories burned from exercise? I have set my activity level to sedentary and add exercise calories so I #8217;m eating up to 500 more cals a day than my base calorie level (set to lose 2lbs a week) and I #8217;m stalled out of the gate. Wondering if it #8217;s better for me to stick to the lower cal level regardless of activity level per day? Has anyone had to do this? Edit: I have it set to 20% deficit and 2lbs per MONTH not week. I have 10-15lbs to lose and also clearly need coffee...
Thank you!
Interesting! I hadn #8217;t thought to try that.
The calc is starting me at 25g carbs. Does anyone use that or is 20g considered the most effective max? If I #8217;m in ketosis do those 5g make a difference?
Got it. Thanks for the tip!
Yes. I get silent migraines with little or no head pain but lots of other symptoms. My doc said to take ibuprofen nonetheless. I guess it helps?

Yes I think it #8217;s normal for a new maintenance med. After a few weeks on a new daily dose you should have your levels rechecked to make sure its the right dose. Your doctor should also check with you about your symptoms. As long as you #8217;re feeling better and your levels are in range, you will likely get ongoing refills after the first month or two.
Yep. Exactly me. Sleepy/fatigue/brain fog and migraine! Same with garlic, or any other allium cooked or raw.
Yep. Exactly me. Sleepy/fatigue/brain fog and migraine! Same with garlic, or any other allium cooked or raw.
I used to be OK with cooked alliums too but over time I couldn #8217;t tolerate them either.

I can relate. 5 #8217;6 #8221; 45 years old SW: 146 CW: 142 GW: 128. Week 3. I am trying to take it slowly and remind myself that even if it takes a year it will be worth it. I have had some super hungry days where my cals and carbs have jumped and I think I even knocked myself out of ketosis for a day (oops) so I am not 100% hitting my goals... but net carbs never above 40. My next step is to tighten that up and be strict about lt;20g but part of me would prefer this to work more slowly and sustainably. I keep telling myself to trust the process too and am enjoying the non-scale benefits (no more brain fog or bloating, more energy). I don #8217;t really have advice but did want to say I can relate. I think when you have less to lose it takes longer?

I #8217;m 3.5 weeks into keto and my periods can be erratic (very short to a little long) because I #8217;m 45 but just wanted to say I #8217;ve been waiting and waiting and feeling symptoms for days. SW finally arrived this morning 4-6 days late. Hang in there!

WRITING.TITLE: Different symptoms depending on trigger?
WRITING.TEXT: DAE feel like they have distinct migraine symptoms based on the trigger? Like food triggers give me brain fog and fatigue and mild headache, exercise-induced migraines have auras, smells are painful headache and nausea, and jet lag causes vision loss without headache. Or maybe it #8217;s just a coincidence that I remember symptoms of different attacks that happen to correspond to different triggers.

Could be related to your body adapting to ketosis? That #8217;s the feeling I get when I go into ketosis. I remember moments in the past (have done keto on and off for years) where I would be walking down the street and suddenly feel my legs go weak/tingly/achy and say to myself #8220;yep, there it is, I #8217;m back in ketosis! #8221; It was my sure sign and always a relief...
I forgot to mention the caffeine migraines! Withdrawal is the worst with full body symptoms. And too much caffeine is its own brand of fun.

WRITING.TITLE: Levo and caffeine timing
WRITING.TEXT: I #8217;ve seen various suggestions about when to take levo in relation to food and caffeine. I know empty stomach is best and at least an hour (or 4?) before caffeine. What about breakfast? I #8217;ve been drinking coffee upon waking (necessary), waiting an hour to take levo on an empty stomach, then waiting at least 30 minutes to eat and another 3O minutes before a second cup of coffee (also necessary at the moment). So technically I #8217;m taking the pill on a empty stomach but after a dose of caffeine an hour before. For years I didn #8217;t pay attention to timing and took levo or Armour with coffee and breakfast. What I #8217;m doing now is what works for me in terms of my caffeine habits but I #8217;m wondering if I should really be taking the levo an hour *before* any coffee for optimal absorption. Anyone have ideas? I don #8217;t see an endo just my PCP and she doesn #8217;t get into these details... Thanks!
Makes sense. Thanks for the input!

My TSH is in range but I still feel some symptoms so I was wondering if making sure I was #8220;getting the most #8221; out of my dosage would make a difference. I haven #8217;t checked levels since spacing out the caffeine doses so I should probably ask my doc to recheck.

WRITING.TITLE: NSV - first time someone noticed a difference
WRITING.TEXT: And it wasn #8217;t my husband! He hasn #8217;t noticed anything. I #8217;ve only lost 4-5lbs in 4 weeks (I #8217;ve got around 15 more to go) but as I was wheeling my parents back to their room at the nursing home where I #8217;ve been visiting them weekly for the last 1.5 years one of the aides said #8220;are you a different daughter? #8221; When I said no she said #8220;you look different, did you lose weight or something? #8221; It always always feels good when it comes out of the blue like that, no matter where!

I did the switch the other way, from Armour to levothyroxine and had hyper symptoms - not insomnia but crushing chest pain that sent me to the hospital! Afterward my doc found that my levels were off and we adjusted the levo dose down.

72 hour water fast, at hour 62 Coffee, tea and electrolyte drops I #8217;m fasting for weight loss and autophagy. I #8217;d like to make this a regular practice to mitigate a long list of health and cosmetic concerns. I #8217;ve been keto for 6 weeks (with a few vacation treats right before I started the fast) and would like to start IF/OMAD when I #8217;m done. I did the Prolon FMD once a year ago and this feels similar. I have a rare weekend home alone (without kids) and I #8217;m very glad to be alone with few obligations because I can just rest and binge Netflix (Great British Baking Show of all things). I #8217;m not sure how I would handle this if I had to be more active - maybe it would be distracting and therefore easier? I feel physically drained but not hungry. I #8217;m not actually looking forward to eating. It feels like it will be an unpleasant shock to the system. I did battle the urge to end early yesterday but distracted myself by watching YT videos about autophagy!

Don #8217;t have an answer but wanted to say I #8217;ve had a similar experience during a relatively short fast (72 hours). To distract myself in the final hours I started trying on old dresses I haven #8217;t fit in since having kids and they were LOOSE on me. Very surprising to have my size change so quickly and dramatically, I suppose because I expect my weight to go back up once I break the fast. It will be interesting (and amazing) if they still fit!

I found Jason Fung #8217;s The Obesity Code explained it really well (a recommended read during an extended water fast!). A good summary from him on #8220;Fasting Myths #8221; including effect on metabolism here: https://www.dietdoctor.com/fasting-myths
I bought the Renpho recently too and I love it! It #8217;s 1000x better than my old Fitbit scale, so much more accurate and reliable. Haven #8217;t had any trouble with it yet.
That #8217;s great to hear. I have spent so much $$$ on creams and serums and laser treatments for rosacea and melasma over the years. I #8217;m hoping IF can do a better and more permanent job!

15 hours into a 46 hour water fast. I have been struggling with 16/8 and 18/6 and had hoped to transition to OMAD by now after a 69 hour water fast two weeks ago. Kids are away for one night so I #8217;m grabbing this opportunity. I don #8217;t know how to explain to them why I #8217;m skipping dinner otherwise (they are 4 and 7) without giving them confusing messages about food and eating. I have a history of disordered eating and after being in such a good place before and after the last water fast, IF seems to be triggering overeating for me. I #8217;d like to #8220;reset #8221; my hunger cues. I want to fast regularly for the health benefits, for the autophagy to protect against aging, inflammation and disease. I #8217;d also like my skin to clear up (melasma, KP, rosacea, flat warts, etc). I would love to go long enough someday for the arthritic pain that #8217;s starting in my fingers (I #8217;m 45 F) to disappear. My parents have both been severely debilitated at a relatively young age with multiple auto-immune conditions. I also have hypothyroidism and one brain lesion consistent with MS that has me freaked out. AND I have 15 lbs to lose. Lost 7 last fast but gained 5 back. I plan to do a 3-5 day water fast next month and the month after. Then switch to once a quarter. I think I will try 5:2 (low carb and gluten free, as I do now) for the rest of the time, which would be 5 days a week of IF and 2 non-consecutive days with OMAD of 500 cals, low carb and low protein...
I lost 7lbs and gained 5 back. Edit to add: SW 143 EW 136 CW 141
You will not lose muscle if you stick to water only. Look up Dr Jason Fung #8217;s #8220;Therapeutic Fasting #8221; talk on YouTube.
Love Renpho!

I watch #8220;The Science of Fasting #8221;, #8220;Eat, Fast and Live Longer #8221; and Dr. Jason Fung #8217;s #8220;Therapeutic Fasting #8221; on YouTube. Any clips I can find of Valter Longo or Jason Fung help motivate me to keep going. Perversely I also find that binge-watching #8220;The Great British Baking Show #8221; helps me too.

I made it past 36 hours on a water fast and will break the fast sometime this morning or afternoon. Ideally I #8217;d do 48 hours but that would end me at 7:30pm which is when I usually stop eating on IF and I need to give my body more time to ease back into eating before the work week. Yesterday was harder than I expected and it was very hard to sleep last night but I feel much better this morning. Having black cold brew coffee and feel like I could keep going indefinitely! I #8217;m amazed at everyone who can do EF for 5+ days (I #8217;ve only done 3 days once recently) and glad to have had this practice. I will try more 36-48 hours so I can build up to 5 days. I want that autophagy!

Good luck! You can do this! Black coffee will get you through, and I suggest electrolytes instead of juice if you #8217;re feeling light-headed. Journaling is a great idea - it #8217;s crazy what can come up when you abstain from familiar comfort habits.
Congrats! Hold on to that feeling!
I have been taking 100mcg of levo for years. I #8217;m 45(F) and fasting works for me. It #8217;s the only thing that works for me. Edit: I #8217;ve only done short fasts, IF and 2-3 days.
Seriously. How do you get it so smooth and even? Mine is so bumpy.
I have a Renpho and l love it! I was talking about how nice this downward slope looks compared to my very #8220;bumpy #8221; ups and downs :) Congrats!!
Would love to read this but don #8217;t have a subscription....

36 hours into a 5(?) day water fast. May break at 45 hours for a social gathering (BBQ) that I don #8217;t want to be weird about. Then back into 72 hours before another social event. Why? A myriad of health concerns. Primarily want to get rid of the arthritic pain starting in my hands (45F) but also concerned about skin issues, allergies, protecting against aging-related disease, neuro-degeneration, etc. I also have about 15lbs I #8217;d like to lose but am trying to focus on health first and not fixate on weight loss. I feel great! Though it was hard to sleep last night and I had intense dreams. Planning to stick to black coffee, lemon water, electrolytes and herbal tea.
Just the basic mint and chamomile mostly.

WRITING.TITLE: Solution for gurgling stomach noise?
WRITING.TEXT: My skeptical husband has said he wants to try fasting! One of his major concerns is how to stop his empty stomach from making noise. He #8217;s a professional recording artist (audiobooks) and cannot have his stomach growling in the recording booth. It disrupts the entire session. Has anyone found a way to quiet an empty stomach during IF or is he out of luck?
I had Alice in Wonderland syndrome as a child. Feel it rarely as an adult. It #8217;s associated with migraines too.
Alice in Wonderland syndrome?
If my eyes are closed and there is a sudden loud sound I #8220;see #8221; it as a bright bright flash.
I always wondered!

I was diagnosed over 10 years ago (45F) and have taken Armour and now levo. I had an MRI recently and the results noted that my thyroid was #8220;small #8221;. I can only assume this could contribute to me being hypo and I guess I #8217;m glad if that #8217;s the answer versus an autoimmune condition. I #8217;m OK on levo but have had to do a lot of tweaking (diet, etc.) to feel better over the years.
BBQ potato chips

42-48 hour water fast. Almost 34 hours in. My very skeptical husband agreed to try one day a week of fasting (36 hours) after hearing about how #8220;all the Cross Fitters are doing it #8221;. I #8217;ve been doing IF with some 40+ and 60+ mixed in for about 3 months now. Yesterday was our fasting day. I made cheeseburgers for our kids last night and he caved and ate one... but he went 23 hours so I #8217;m proud of him. I feel great this AM after black coffee. Going to do a light fasted workout. I swear my arthritic finger pain in the AM is lessening...
I watch the Great British Baking Show
Oh boy... luckily I am gluten intolerant so that turns me off from actually wanting to eat any of it.

Day One of a 71 hour water fast. I usually do IF with one 41 hour fast per week for general health and weight loss. This week is a tough one and I #8217;m caught in a stress eating cycle. I want to break that cycle and take comfort in the profound peace I feel during an extended fast. I look forward to breaking the fast and celebrating the end of this difficult week on Friday. My motivation feels shakier than usual though and I #8217;m a little worried that for the first time I #8217;m choosing fasting as a reaction to stress instead of for the health benefits. It reminds me of ED behavior which I have a long ago history of. I don #8217;t want to be turning to fasting as a psychological salve or attempt to control my world when it feels out of control. But that #8217;s where I #8217;m at.

I am celiac negative (blood test) but have itchy bumps on my elbows which I now think are a sign I #8217;ve been glutened. Cleared up when I went GF but returns (also on arms and hands) when I #8217;ve been careless about checking the ingredients and find out there #8217;s wheat in something I ate.
Yep that #8217;s the reaction I get from garlic and onions. Migraines too. Took me years to figure out they were the cause!

Almost 34 hours in. Going for 90+. Water, coffee, tea, La Croix (treating myself this time). Maybe ACV, lemon juice and pink salt at some point. Probably electrolytes if I need them. Goals are: autophagy and immune improvement, reduce joint pain, break the binge habit I was slipping into. Have been doing weekly 42h fasts and daily IF. How #8217;s it going? Good. I feel like I #8217;m over the hump. Hard to sleep but that #8217;s OK! It #8217;s temporary.

Planned for a quiet weekend with my family but then learned my MIL is coming to stay on Sunday! So I just decided to end at 92 hours instead of 114 and avoid the nonsense of cooking a meal for everyone and sitting there not eating it with them.
Thanks! Energy is great. Couldn #8217;t keep my eyes open while overeating every day earlier this week. That #8217;s why I don #8217;t mind losing sleep at night.

I #8217;m left handed and so is my brother and we both suffer from migraines of differing severity. My mother (right-handed) used to get them too. Her mother was left-handed. I #8217;ve heard of other health issues that are related but don #8217;t remember hearing this before. Left-handers have funky brains!
Go go go!
I #8217;m right there with you. Started Wed at 8pm, will probably start breaking the fast mid-afternoon Sunday to ease back into eating, so around 90 to 92 hours total. We can do this! Edit: math
Google #8220;benefits of fasting #8221; and find some inspiration in how healthy you #8217;re getting. Watch a Valter Longo or Jason Fung talk on YouTube...

Day 3 of 4. Water, coffee and tea. Woke up around 3am and I #8217;m still up, just waiting for it to be time to have some coffee. I can do this but right now I #8217;m feeling weak, have palpitations, a gnawing burning feeling in my stomach and all over head and face pain. Also got my period yesterday (F/45 BMI 22). Fun. The longest I #8217;ve gone before this is 69 hours with some weekly 42s. Doing it for the cellular renewal, autophagy goodness. Happy I #8217;ve made it this far. Have to take my kids to two soccer practices today. Coffee here I come! And electrolytes. UPDATE: feel totally good and normal after coffee and salt and herbal tea! Hello Day Three energy!
Congrats! You did it!!

Yep. Something that helps me is just knowing it #8217;s temporary which helps me relax and accept it. I just get up and do stuff if I can #8217;t sleep. Jason Fung talks about it in Peter Attia #8217;s podcast, how it #8217;s a thing but if you anticipate and accept it, that makes it easier. There are also recommended supplements (just saw the Zero app has some listed in one of its articles) to help but I haven #8217;t tried them while fasting.

WRITING.TITLE: Finally made it to that last icon in the Life app - yesssss!

WRITING.TEXT: Thanks! May only make it to 84. Depends how I feel after I wake up Sunday morning. Congrats on 72!
Lowest insulin level and the breaking down of old immune cells. Explained here: https://lifeapps.io/fasting/the-5-stages-of-intermittent-fasting/
You can do it! So satisfying.

Day 4 water/coffee fast. Will break fast this morning or afternoon for 83-90 total hours. I feel great. It #8217;s my longest fast recently and so satisfying to make it here. I made a pasta and meatball dinner for family and friends last night and had a La Croix while they ate and I tried to answer my friend #8217;s questions about why I #8217;m fasting so long. I have to admit I was googling around yesterday to try to find how long you *really* have to fast to get the immune benefits. I think the answer is we don #8217;t really know since studies are mostly in mice and yeast? but Valter Longo says humans should go at least 4-5 days so here I am. I had to taste a speck of plain tomato sauce while I was cooking yesterday for saltiness. About an hour later I noticed a flair up of an allergic rash I get on my elbows and chest (usually a gluten reaction). I #8217;ve also noticed after shorter fasts that I have a mild allergic reaction to nuts. FARG. Nightshades I can handle avoiding but I don #8217;t think I can live without nuts. I already eat low carb and avoid peanuts, gluten and garlic and onions. I #8217;ve been hoping fasting can help alleviate my various food intolerances in the end. I love food but a lot of it makes me feel like crap #128553;

Good luck! Going to sleep last night I was envisioning bacon and eggs with an avocado on the side and a whole cauliflower crust pizza topped with arugula to break my fast today. Problem is I can eat a lot once I start. I just keep adding more and more snacks and it never stops until my window closes again. But after 4 days I do think my stomach will hurt if I eat everything I was fantasizing about in one sitting!
Totally. I love waking up and checking my fasting timer and seeing in jump ahead so many hours!
Yuck

You #8217;ll know. Took me 4 days to get there and I #8217;m so sad to have to let it go because I just broke my fast. In my experience, I felt more present and connected and just GOOD. Music sounded better, I observed a leaf blowing in the wind with brilliant clarity and I fully appreciated the leaf. A very zen state. Calm and patient and aware. Energized and motivated. I wanted it to last forever...

40 hour water fast, doing this weekly. 34 hours in. Slept really well for a change and feel good this AM. Really struggled with cravings at dinner time yesterday while cooking for my family but told myself #8220;it comes in waves, this will pass #8221; and it sure did. I was looking forward to feeling good this AM, drinking black coffee and having no hunger and here I am! It really does get easier the more your body gets used to it. Going to stick to this once a week plus another ADF day of 500 cals or less (F/45/5 #8217;6 #8221;/136lbs) with EF every three months. Goals are clearing up various symptoms, preventing disease and losing like 10 more lbs.
Great job! There is nothing like that energy and motivation that hits after a few days. Enjoy.

I tried on a bunch of old clothes (clearing out a storage closet) last weekend and it was the best most motivating feeling. Dresses that were a little too tight for me even in my previous #8220;thin #8221; days fit or were loose! Amazing that at 45 after two kids my body is leaner than in my 20s. Now the wrinkles are harder to get rid of...
Totally. I was dying to eat last night for about an hour. Now 16 hours later I still haven #8217;t eaten and have zero appetite. May have to force myself to have lunch...

ADF twice a week. 47 hours this time, 11 hours in. It seems to get easier each time? I just have to ride the wave of hunger that comes at dinner while I make cheeseburgers for my kids. I was feeling good last week but the rebound eating last weekend was BAD. I honestly still feel full days later. Tracking calories is too triggering for me so OMAD may be my best option for the days I eat. Fasting feels easier than eating sometimes. Goals: disease prevention, clearing up symptoms, weight loss. Decided to only weigh myself once a week. I was getting too obsessed with scale numbers and my RENPHO app. 10lbs to lose but there #8217;s no rush... UPDATE: welp I did a sanity check and quit at 20 hrs. Realized I was feeling and sounding a bit disordered... I have a long/long-ago history of ED and did not come this far to give myself another eating disorder. This is about health after all! One full day (40-46 hrs) a week is plenty on top of IF and EF with my stats.
Good luck! You #8217;ve got this.
This is the lesson I #8217;m learning too. It #8217;s an adjustment!

I think it #8217;s possible. Anecdotally people can feel euphoric after 3-4 days of water fasting. I know I do. And if you #8217;re eating a less-than-ideal diet (hidden food allergies or intolerances) a fast could remove the negative effects of that.

Yep. I am hypo (not hashi) and a GF diet dramatically improved my overall well being. No more fatigue brain fog migraines skin rash etc. At the same time I went GF I also changed the way I take my levo dose (away from caffeine which can decrease absorption) and my latest TSH level was much lower (almost too low) than it #8217;s ever been on the same dose. I wondered if the GF diet helped that or just the caffeine adjustment. In any case, I notice when I accidentally have gluten because I get a rash but also nausea, brain fog etc. Edit to add: I have also tested negative for celiac.

Elbows mostly. Sometimes fingers and arms. I have had mild rashes on my chest but I #8217;m not sure if it #8217;s related. I have joint pain too (just fingers and toes) but that doesn #8217;t seem to ever go away :(

Interesting. I am negative for celiac but have symptoms unless I stay gluten free. I also get symptoms from garlic and onions (high fructan). Any idea where to find those studies linking fructan and NCGS?
Dumb question: is it possible to lose weight without counting calories if you do IF every day with some longer fasts (42-70) thrown in? Counting cals is so triggering for me...

Thank you! Gives me the hope I was fishing for :) Problem is I *feel* like I #8217;m putting away 3000+ cals on the days I eat (my TDEE is 1800-1900). I don #8217;t eat junk but do eat a lot of calorie dense nuts and things and I seem to have gained a few pounds back. But I won #8217;t really know for sure unless I force myself to count. My other options I think are to go keto and/or cut out the nuts... :(
No tips but am pleased to see the Hampshire CSA still going. I was a member like... 25 years ago #128558;

Wow thank you so much. All things I #8220;know #8221; but it truly helps to have someone else tell you! I think you #8217;re right that OMAD could solve my problem. And transitioning to keto - I #8217;ve done it before but last time with CICO and no IF and the counting drove me crazy. I keep telling myself to measure my nut and nut butter servings! Better stop saying it and just do it :D Thank you thank you thank you for taking the time to advise a stranger on reddit! It was the kick I needed.

I am hypo not hashi #8217;s and used to take levo with black coffee every morning. A few months ago I started waiting an hour after I had caffeine to take my pill, then waiting another hour before any more caffeine. My levels really changed! TSH dropped a lot suggesting better absorption. I did make some other changes (like going gluten free) but I think spacing out the caffeine was the significant factor.

I #8217;ve found Migraine Stick (search for it on Amazon) a life saver for scent triggers. It #8217;s a roll on stick that you can put on your temples etc but I also go ahead and shove it up my nose. Have used it for air freshener assaults in the Milan airport (so strong I could literally *taste* the scent) and anytime some dude with strong cologne sits next to me on the train.

I used to have BED (have been free of it for around a decade) and have been doing IF and EF for the last six months. At first it was easy and I lost weight but then I think my body #8220;noticed #8221; and this triggered binge eating again. Such a bummer after believing I was finally free of an awful, awful eating disorder. It really sucks because I #8217;m committed to IF and EF for disease prevention and longevity more than weight loss. My only advice, which I #8217;m trying to give myself, is to NOT push yourself too hard or double down when you aren #8217;t seeing results. I think that #8217;s the ED mentality that can trap you in a downward spiral. IMHO, counting calories is impossible for those with a history of eating disorders. OMAD may be a useful tool but not if you don #8217;t eat enough or are too strict about it or use it as a punishment. Does that make sense? I #8217;m trying to regroup after weeks of binges and think my path forward is to do what is easy and comfortable (for me that #8217;s 16:8) and not push for OMAD or regular 40+ hour fasts until the binge monster relaxes. Good luck to you!
Say no thanks I can #8217;t eat sugar or I can #8217;t eat gluten. IME people don #8217;t notice if you do or don #8217;t eat something as much as you think they do.

I would go with what feels right for you. Personally I don #8217;t push for longer fasts when I have a cold. Just getting over my second one of the season and I #8217;m waiting until I feel healthy to do anything more than 18-20 hours. It #8217;s just my instinct to not #8220;stress #8221; my system right now. Not too hungry so it #8217;s easy to stick to healthy low carb in a restricted window.

Yes. Going along with Zero Fasting #8217;s #8220;Fast Before the Feast #8221;. Most looking forward to gluten-free pizza and cake Wed night to celebrate my birthday one day early (spending my bday cooking a turkey dinner #128580;)

I have been reading this thread all morning and not 15 minutes ago I learned the proper way to use those tree-shaped car air fresheners. According to the packaging, you open the top of the plastic bag and expose the tip of the tree only (first set of #8220;branches #8221;). Each week, as the scent wears out, you expose a little more of the tree. This way it lasts 7 weeks and isn #8217;t obnoxiously overpowering like it is if you pull the whole thing out and hang it completely exposed on your rear view mirror!
Says age 51 at top. Wow! That #8217;s amazing. Congratulations!!!
Really hoping no one is trying to sell to the residents! Probably not, probably just staff or a visitor dropped it in the elevator, but talk about a vulnerable audience.

35 hours water fasting. Having black coffee now and will end at 42-45 hours. Haven #8217;t fasted past 20 hours since before Thanksgiving. Before that I was sick for several weeks so I didn #8217;t do any overnight fasts. Now I #8217;ve undone my (minor) weight loss so need to get back on track. I was daunted and almost gave in while feeding my kids dinner Last night but was able to remind myself that the hunger comes in waves, is always strongest at dinner time and would be gone by the time I woke up. And here I am! Planning my next extended fast of 5 days after Christmas. Autophagy and disease prevention is number one, weight loss a nice bonus.

It #8217;s absolutely true about the ups and downs. If you can keep that in mind and push through the difficult moments you will be rewarded! Have some salt if you feel really weak or hungry. You #8217;ve got this!

Was going to do an extended fast after Christmas, decided yesterday to do it before. So: day one of a 4 day (94 hour) water fast. Looking forward to the break from food. Expecting to drink black coffee, tea, lemon juice, ACV, salt and electrolytes. Will break fast with a Christmas Eve dinner which I #8217;ll cook for family. Need to get myself into the right mindset. I #8217;ve been stress eating and drinking since Thanksgiving. Edit: I can #8217;t do math early in the morning. It will be 5 days until Xmas eve! So planning 118 hours (not 94), my longest ever. May still stick to 94 hours to break fast carefully before feast.
Love the euphoria and that overall calm and ease. Looking forward to it myself.
That was my original plan too and I think I #8217;m still going to do that instead. Works better for me to fast once the Christmas festivities are over. So I #8217;m resetting.
I #8217;m with you! Aiming for 118 hours. So glad the Christmas eating is over. Ugh.

Day 1 of 5 days. Water and tea. Coffee is my BFF but I #8217;m cutting it out for the new year. Goal is: my quarterly extended fast for autophagy, prevention of disease and the effects of aging. Weight loss will be good too because in the last month I #8217;m sure I #8217;ve gained back what I lost from when I started fasting this summer (only 6-8lbs). In the new year I plan to keep doing one 47hr fast per week and one 5 day fast every 3 months. Keto and mild CICO for further health benefits. 46F and my new motto is exercise is not optional. I would like to lose 20-25lbs but health is my focus now, not weight, so I will weigh myself less often (love my RENPHO scale)
Yep, I #8217;m fasting from Xmas night to Dec 30. 5 days. My longest fast was 90 hrs. This will be 118.

Day 2 of 5 - a third of the way there! Feels great to be fasting again. I can #8217;t believe I #8217;ve had just water and tea (no coffee) and feel fine. I even worked out this morning, just 1200m row at an easy pace. Taking electrolytes and taking it easy. I have a mild cold and need to take Sudafed to avoid recurrent sinus infections. It does suppress appetite so that #8217;s a help!
You need to reach each icon in order to see the next I believe. Good motivation to keep going with your fast! Also, I use both apps daily!

I #8217;m halfway through a 118 hour water fast. I cut out coffee and am just drinking water and green tea and I #8217;m sleeping better than I have in months. It might be that I #8217;m on vacation and can wake up later (or go back to sleep after I wake up at 5am) but in any case, sleep is good. Usually extended fasting keeps me up at night so this is a welcome surprise.

Day 4. 33 hours left of a 118hr water fast. I was expecting this to be the best day but I had bad sleep and lots of heart palpitations. Woke up feeling dizzy and grumpy. Not hungry at all, just weak. I had some pink salt and electrolytes, then some green tea. Hoping to feel a boost of energy like I had last time I got to day 4. If not I may end later today for a 90-94hr fast. Not my goal, but not bad.

WRITING.TITLE: Cracked heels?
WRITING.TEXT: I see anecdotally that quitting caffeine has improved people #8217;s skin. Has anyone experienced an improvement to severally cracked heels?

I guess it #8217;s too much to hope for a miracle cure. I am well-hydrated (drink plenty of water and herbal tea all day every day) and well-moisturized. I only drank one cup of coffee/day until two weeks ago when I quit but have been drinking at least that much for 30ish years.
Thank you! I #8217;ve tried it all but not this and it sounds promising.
Do you think you might be grinding or clenching your teeth when you sleep? Do you wake up with a headache? Have you ever tried a mouth guard at night?
This is my worst nightmare. I have the oddest phobia of things, especially plants, growing out of places they #8220;shouldn #8217;t #8221;.

WRITING.TITLE: Misdiagnosed this time?
WRITING.TEXT: TL/DR: diagnosed with my second case of shingles in 3 months but only had one blister on the opposite side from previous rash. Took antivirals right away and rash never grew or spread and I had no nerve pain. Other symptoms were ongoing low grade fever and painful swollen glands in my neck (nowhere near my blister). Was I misdiagnosed? My first case of shingles was 3 months ago. Classic pain first then obvious rash, took antivirals and it slowly resolved. I was incredibly lucky that the nerve pain was never that bad. Then a week or so ago I noticed I had a low grade fever after minor surgery for a ventral hernia. Also aches and pains but not in the same area as the first case of shingles. Checked with surgeon - no infection. Developed painful swollen glands in my neck a few days later which my ENT thought was some kind of infection. Started antibiotics then woke up the next day with an open blister that looked/felt like the start of a shingles rash in the same area as my first rash but across the midline. Went to urgent care immediately and they agreed with me, gave me antivirals. I stopped the antibiotics. Since then the rash hasn #8217;t developed at all and I haven #8217;t had any pain that corresponds. It #8217;s hard to believe this is shingles unless it #8217;s a very mild case?
Kinda what I was thinking but I #8217;ve never seen anyone describe a mild case that was *this* mild. Who knows, maybe the low grade fever was doing the work before any rash erupted?
UPDATE: 5 days after diagnosis the rash popped up in a nearby area, complete with burning itchy discomfort! Yuck. But it #8217;s a relief to know I got the diagnosis right and started the meds early.

I have a long past history of disordered eating and while I #8217;ve had success with IF and extended fasting I do find it triggers periods of bingeing. This has led me to regain the small amount of weight I lost initially. FWIW I do not eat junk food and eat carefully even when I binge (worst vices are raw nuts, hard cheeses, avocado, that sort of thing). I #8217;m not sure how to get past this. I have tried easing up and skipping longer or extended fasts for awhile while sticking to my baseline of 16:8 but even then I find binge behavior creeping in. The health benefits of fasting are so important to me to stave off age-related disease based on my genetics that I don #8217;t want to give it up completely. I #8217;ve also tried keto and CICO but those are way too triggering. I think my only advice is to ease up on the restrictions when binges flare up as opposed to doubling down. In my experience this approach is the only way out of an eating disorder. Easier said than done of course but maybe I need to take my own advice and take a break for now...

My elderly parents are in a nursing home in my town (I moved them here to be closer to me). We are just a few miles from the first #8220;containment area #8221; in the U.S. They are both essentially bed-ridden and in bad shape with chronic illnesses - dementia, RA, Parkinson #8217;s, etc. The nursing home closed to outside visitors on Monday. I #8217;m lucky that they are protected and getting the 24/7 care they need but now I can #8217;t go see them and help them if they need me and because of the heartbreaking stories from Washington State I #8217;m scared that they will get trapped there with the virus spreading like wildfire. There are no active cases there yet but I feel it #8217;s only a matter of time. Thanks for listening.

Well I feel better now. Had a scare last year about a white matter lesion on my brain MRI that had "interval development" from 8 years before. No one said it was "normal" but I did have a Lyme disease test and follow up cervical and thoracic MRIs which were all clear. Looking at the original report again I do see that it mentions migraines as a possible cause...

I have noticed an increase in anxiety, irritability and general low mood when I lengthen my eating window. In my case I think it #8217;s because I #8217;m eating compulsively due to stress and it #8217;s clear to me that it #8217;s a vicious cycle. You eat, feel anxiety, eat to quell the anxiety, have more anxiety... story of most of my life. I just don #8217;t think intuitive eating will work for me, at least not when I #8217;m stressed out. Strict IF is my remedy.

I have a 4 and 8 year old and they barely notice if I #8217;m eating or not. I did explain fasting to them when I first starting doing it regularly and now my older one just says #8220;are you fasting? #8221; if he notices I just have tea at dinner. They accept it, are totally non-plussed by it and don #8217;t care. Too focused on their own food. Originally I explained that it was for my health - that #8220;big people #8221; don #8217;t need food as much as kids and sometimes it #8217;s good for our bodies to take a break, it helps avoid getting sick like grandma and grandpa, etc. and is like medicine for adults, but since kids are still growing they need to eat every day.
I was diagnosed with eczema on both my elbows and it looks a lot like that... prescription cream was the only thing that cleared it up.
Yep. Outside elbows.

WRITING.TITLE: 3rd case in 6 months - anyone else getting it this frequently?
WRITING.TEXT: I got shingles for the first time 6 months ago, then I got them again 3 months later and now I just got hit with a third case... Anyone else get this every 3 months? I #8217;m 46 and my doctor suggested I could get the vaccine #8220;in a few years #8221; (I assume she meant when I am 50) but another doc told me I should get one sooner. Has anyone gotten the vaccine before age 50?
I like this tip! I use both apps daily and am going to try setting Zero for 24hr at a time on my next EF
You can do this! Stay strong and you will be at the finish line before you know it.

14 hrs in of 71. A #8220;dirty #8221; fast with black coffee, tea, electrolytes, lemon juice, ACV, broth, La Croix, etc. Whatever gets me through. Weight loss is the goal this time. I had a lot of success with IF and EF last year but quarantine has flared my disordered eating and caused me to gain weight past what I lost. Argh!!! 46F. 20lbs to lose. Considering doing #8220;rolling 72s #8221; after this. I #8217;ve failed at everything else I #8217;ve tried recently - keto, ADF, CICO, OMAD...
Nice! How did you manage to avoid bingeing? What did you eat and did you restrict your window at all on those two days?

Thanks for the tip! Very helpful right about now. From what I understand rolling 72s is a 72 hr fast, then eat one meal and go straight back into another 72 hour fast. Now that I write that down it sounds extreme... I guess another option is rolling 48s.

I #8217;m 26hrs into a 72. Have been struggling to get back to fasting since quarantine. Did well with IF and EF last year but am now at a higher weight than when I started! 46F, 5 #8217;6 #8221; SW - 150 GW -130.

Hour 35 of 71. It #8217;s not much but I #8217;ve been struggling for months to get back to this. Such a relief to be on the other side of the first 24 hours. I feel pretty dizzy this morning and my 5-year-old has been waking me up all night so I #8216;m sucking down black coffee now. Hoping to go for a run before everyone else wakes up.
I remember reading once that it has to do with hydration levels. You are always dehydrated in the morning and that affects how your BF% gets read.
Thanks! Feel pretty good after my run and some electrolytes.
You #8217;re doing great! Congrats on your progress and keep it up!
65 is a great accomplishment! And you can do it again! I #8217;m on my way to 72. 28 hours to go...

I relapsed in quarantine as well and undid a lot of hard work. I struggled for a long time to get past needing to overeat every day but I finally did it and am 43 hours into an extended fast. It feels tremendous. You can do it too!
Welcome! I #8217;ve seen it said that fasting is like a muscle and the more you do it the easier it gets. You can absolutely work your way up to 3 days.

I #8217;m really interested in what you said about monthly maintenance helping with feeling tired. I struggle so much with fatigue and lack of motivation. I #8217;m also addicted to caffeine. I do think I had much better energy when I did EF more regularly. Another reason to get back to it!
I won #8217;t let you down
Amazing! You must feel so good.
Awesome job!
Wow. What #8217;s your ultimate goal? What #8217;s your plan after you end this fast? Would you ever do such a long fast again?

Hour 60/70. Almost there. Second night of sleep was rough. Heart pounding and hard to sleep. Got some insight though in the middle of the night. Looking at my fasting and weight history over the last year I noticed that weight loss was slow but going in the right direction when I was doing 20-23 hours per day with one 40-42 per week. When I stopped the weekly 40s and my daily fasts crept back to 16 or 18, my weight started going in the wrong direction. It #8217;s obvious of course that less fasted hours would lead to less weight loss and even gain, but it was helpful to see the charts and graphs showing me that trend. This fast has taught me that I can do 40-48 at least once a week again and can stick to OMAD the rest of the time. Thank you fasting.

I wonder too. I #8217;m anxious to get this weight off but also want a sustainable habit. Maybe a few 72s once in awhile mixed in with 48s. Honestly now that I #8217;m at 65 hours I really feel like I could keep going!!
Start by skipping breakfast! Make your eating window smaller and smaller over time. You can do it!
Homemade cauliflower crust pizza with garlic infused oil, mozzarella and ricotta, topped with arugula. After 70 hours.
Love that immune system refresh badge. Only got that far once. Hope to get there again soon.

Yep. I developed it on my outer elbows (I thought it might be DH too and got tested for celiac, avoided gluten, etc.) in my 40s. Prescription cream from my dermatologist was miraculous in clearing it up.
I had it as a child and didn #8217;t realize it was a thing until I was an adult. I only really remember experiencing while lying down. I can #8217;t imagine walking around with things so distorted!
Such a weird thing to experience as a child. I tell my young kids that if they ever feel something like that that it #8217;s normal and OK and they don #8217;t need to be scared.

I am similar to you. 46. Peri but not confirmed with my doc. Hormones were checked awhile ago and were #8220;borderline #8221;. In the last month my period has gone MIA (has been all over the place for the last two years - early, late, heavy, light, short, long, spotting, sometimes cramps, sometimes sore breasts) and the hot flashes and night sweats have become constant. I went through a few rounds of thinning hair but that seems to have stabilized for now. Insomnia has ticked up too lately. The hot flashes bother me most. Just a sudden fire out of the blue burning from the inside out and pouring sweat. Doesn #8217;t help that the weather is extra hot right now. I #8217;m here to commiserate and learn more about HRT. Edit to add: I #8217;ve always battled with about 10-20 extra pounds and gained 10 more lbs during quarantine but suddenly my weight seems to be creeping up again, all in belly fat :(
I got one and deleted it. Obviously someone trying to scam. I #8217;ve only posted on this sub like once!

OMG I live in fear of the dreaded #8220;pine mouth #8221;. When I first encountered it 10 or so years ago I remember hearing that it was caused by cheap imported nuts that had suddenly entered the US market. Not sure if that turned out to be true or not but I am so scared of getting it again that I avoid all pine nuts and only eat homemade pesto made with walnuts. It is worse than losing your sense of taste or smell! Nothing helps and it lasts 24/7 for weeks *shudder*
That was my experience. For the last 2-3 years my cycle shortened from 4 to 3 weeks or less. Then suddenly it stopped completely and the hot flashes hit. I #8217;m 46.
